abstract: The S.E.C. accused the bank of failing to tell investors that a hedge fund that helped create a collateralized debt obligation also bet that the investment would fail.
snippet: The S.E.C. accused the bank of failing to tell investors that a hedge fund that helped create a collateralized debt obligation also bet that the investment would fail.
lead_paragraph: Mark Lennihan/Associated Press The Securities and Exchange Commission said JPMorgan Chase failed to disclose that a hedge fund helped create an investment marketed by the bank while also betting that the deal would fail.

headline.main: JPMorgan Pays $153 Million to Settle Mortgage Case

abstract: The Securities and Exchange Commission announced a $153.6 million accord over charges that the firm misled investors.
snippet: The Securities and Exchange Commission announced a $153.6 million accord over charges that the firm misled investors.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — JPMorgan Chase has agreed to pay $153.6 million to settle federal civil accusations that it misled investors in a complex mortgage securities transaction in 2007, just as the housing market was beginning to plummet, the Securities and Exchange Commission announced Tuesday.
